name: Silver Essence (DC 12)
description: Use a turn to coat your weapon with this silver essence. You weapon counts as silvered for the next minute.

name: Restorative Draught (DC 20)
description: The drinker can spend a restoration dice as if they had a short rest.

name: Throwing Fire (DC 12)
description: Make a ranged attack, on a hit deal 2d4 fire damage. Range: 20 ft.

name: Flash Powder (DC 15)
description: This powder ignites and produces a bright flash, any creature within 5ft of the powder must make a fortitude save or be blinded for 1d3 rounds.

name: Smoke Bombs (DC 10)
description: These bombs create areas of dark smoke.

name: Smelling Salts (DC 10)
description: These smelling salts can be administered as an action to a creature over its wound limit. The creature can ignore one wound for 10 minutes but is stunned during that time. Consecutive used can be dangerous.

name: Stone to Flesh (DC 25)
description: This disgusting mixture can save those turned to stone by some monsters.

name: Ariticeack
description: This poison, brewed from the Ariti flower, inhibits magical power in those who take it. Any spells cast while poisoned by Artiticack cost 1 extra spellcasting ability point.

name: Thanadel
description: When ingested, this poison forces the target to make a DC 20 fortitude save or take 1d4 mortal wound.

name: Daemonbane
description: This plant was a gift from the gods and causes immense pain in any daemons it comes into contact with.
A vial of this poison can be thrown at a daemon. On a hit it deals 2d12 damage. It can also be applied to a weapon. For one minute any hit with that weapon against a daemon deals an extra 1d8 damage.

name: Stolen Venom
description: This poison is harvested from a creature with venom. It can be applied to a weapon. For the next minute the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage on a hit.

name: Waeberry
description: This berry, identical to a blueberry in every way, leads to horrific vomiting, internal bleeding, and death.

1 hour after a creature eats this berry, they must make a DC 15 fortitude save or take 1d2 minor wounds and be poisoned for 24 hours. After another hour the creature must make a DC 18 fortitude save or take a major wound. After the 3rd hour the creature must make a final fortitude save at DC 20 or take a mortal wound.

name: Hastab
description: This purple leafed plant causes vivid hallucinations when taken. It draws the taker to the field of dreams.
